intro: Erica sicula subsp. sicula, commonly known as the Sicilian heath, is a compact evergreen shrub native to the Mediterranean region, particularly Sicily. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring dense clusters of small, needle-like leaves. The plant produces fragrant, bell-shaped flowers in shades of pink, white, and purple, usually blooming in spring. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Erica sicula subsp. sicula is well adapted to coastal and rocky environments, making it a resilient and ornamental plant for gardens.
